claim: Parents share more genes with their child than siblings do.

supporting.text: Parents share approximately 50% of their genes with each child, as each parent contributes half of the child's genetic material.

attacks.text: Parents share approximately 50% of their genes with each child, as each parent contributes half of the child's genetic material.

The 50% shared between siblings is an average—some sibling pairs may share more or less due to random recombination during meiosis.
Identical twins share 100% of their genes, which is more than the 50% shared between parents and children.
Identical twins are a rare exception and do not represent the general case of sibling genetic similarity.
